President Aquino thanked King Philippe for Belgium's support in the rehabilitation of the damage caused by Super Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda) and their support over the [[Peace process with the Bangsamoro in the Philippines|Bangsamoro peace process]].<ref>{{cite news|title=National Day of Belgium|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/national-day-of-belgium/|accessdate=October 4, 2015|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=July 20, 2015}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino met with around 800 members of the Filipino communities in [[Filipinos in Belgium|Belgium]] and Luxembourg at the [[Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula]].<ref name="September 15, 2014"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Meeting with the Filipino Community|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?tag=cathedral-of-st-michael-and-st-gudula|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 4, 2015|date=September 15, 2014}}</ref>
On Tuesday, September 16, President Aquino met with [[European Council]] President [[Herman Van Rompuy]] to discuss the cooperation between the Philippines and the European Union with the signing of the [[European Union Association Agreement|Partnership and Cooperation Agreement]], the Bangsamoro peace process, the Maritime Security Strategy, and the European Union's contributions to resolving the territorial disputes in the South China Sea.<ref>{{cite web|title=Statement of President Aquino after meeting with the President of the European Council in Brussels|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/16/statement-of-president-aquino-meeting-president-european-council-brussels/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 12, 2015|date=September 16, 2014}}</ref> After their meeting, President Aquino met with Prime Minister [[Elio Di Rupo]] at the Prime Minister's [[Prime Minister of Belgium#Official residence|official residence]] in [[Rue de la Loi]], where the two heads of government discussed [[Belgium–Philippines relations#Economic relations|trade relations]].<ref name="Belgium business">{{cite news|title=Aquino holds more business meetings in Belgium|url=http://www.bworldonline.com/content.php?section=Economy&title=aquino-holds-more-business-meetings-in-belgium&id=94601|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[BusinessWorld]]|date=September 16, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Calica|first1=Aurea|title=Phl to abide by rulings on Fraport, lake project|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2014/09/21/1371431/phl-abide-rulings-fraport-lake-project|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=September 21, 2014}}</ref> In the afternoon, President Aquino participated at a conference organized by the [[Department of Trade and Industry (Philippines)|Philippine Department of Trade and Industry]] in association with [[Eurochambres]] and [[Friends of Europe]], aimed at urging Belgian businesses to invest in the [[Public-private partnership#Philippines|Philippines' public-private partnership]] programs.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cariño|first1=Jorge|title=Aquino trumpets PPP gains at Brussels conference|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/business/09/17/14/aquino-trumpets-ppp-gains-brussels-conference|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Marcelo|first1=Elizabeth|title=PNoy pitches investment opportunities to businessmen in Belgium|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/lite/story/379448|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 16, 2014}}</ref> He later held a series of business meetings with officials from [[Royal Dutch Shell]], [[HSBC]], and [[Asia House]].<ref name="Belgium business"/> In the evening, President Aquino headed to the [[Château of Val-Duchesse]] to meet with the [[EGMONT - The Royal Institute for International Relations|Egmont Institute]]. Upon arriving at the chateau, the President's convoy was greeted by protesters from Migrante Europe and other Filipino human rights organizations,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Esguerra|first1=Christian V.|title=Aquino defends his administration's human rights record|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/111277/aquino-defends-his-administrations-human-rights-record|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> who demand his resignation after "four years of massive corruption, blatant subservience to US imperialist dictates and brutal leadership," according to Migrante Europe chairman Garry Martinez.<ref>{{cite web|title=Protests in Europe show disgust and outrage of Filipinos abroad over BS Aquino's corruption, puppetry, and dictatorship|url=http://migranteinternational.org/2014/09/18/protests-in-europe-show-disgust-and-outrage-of-filipinos-abroad-over-bs-aquinos-corruption-puppetry-and-dictatorship/|publisher=[http://migranteinternational.org/ Migrante International]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref> Upon meeting with the Egmont Institute, the President delivered a speech on addressing local and global issues through international cooperation.<ref>{{cite web|title=Policy speech of President Aquino at the 50th anniversary of PH-EU relations|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/16/policy-speech-of-president-aquino-at-the-50th-anniversary-of-ph-eu-relations/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 12, 2015|date=September 16, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 16, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/16/the-presidents-day-september-16-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 12, 2015|date=September 16, 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Benigno Aquino III and François Hollande 19.17.14.jpg|thumb|left|President Aquino with French President François Hollande at a joint press conference in Paris on September 17, 2014.]] On Wednesday, September 17, President Aquino and his delegation departed Brussels and arrived at [[Orly Airport|Paris Orly Airport]] at around 10:05 am CEST.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino arrives in Paris for 2-day official visit|url=http://www.eaglenews.ph/aquino-arrives-in-paris-for-2-day-official-visit/|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[Net 25#Net 25 Eagle News Service|Net 25 Eagle News Service]]|publisher=[[Eagle Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino's visit to France, the first of a Philippine President since President [[Fidel V. Ramos]]'s visit in 1994, was aimed to "reap economic, political and cultural gains" to enhance bilateral cooperation between the two countries, according to French Ambassador Gilles Garachon.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Calleja|first1=Niña P.|title=Aquino's visit seen to boost PH-France ties|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/111045/aquinos-visit-seen-to-boost-ph-france-ties|accessdate=October 13, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 13, 2014}}</ref> After arriving, the President attended a wreath laying ceremony with military honors at the [[Arc de Triomphe#Tomb of the Unknown Soldier|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] under the [[Arc de Triomphe]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino now in Paris, lays wreath at Arc de Triomphe|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/95598/photo--aquino-now-in-paris-lays-wreath-at-arc-de-triomphe|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino then headed to the [[Élysée Palace]] to meet with President [[François Hollande]]. During their bilateral meeting, the two presidents discussed ways to enhance bilateral cooperation and efforts to alleviate [[climate change]]. President Hollande also expressed his support to resolve the territorial disputes in the South China Sea.<ref>{{cite news|title=PH, France deepen bilateral ties with new agreements|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69409-aquino-hollande-france|accessdate=October 13, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref> The two presidents later witnessed the signing of bilateral agreements on air services, education, and cultural ties, before participating in a working lunch and a joint press conference.<ref>{{cite news|title=Philippines, France ink bilateral agreements to strengthen ties|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/business/95649/philippines-france-ink-bilateral-agreements-to-strengthen-ties|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref><ref name="September 17, 2014">{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 17, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/17/the-presidents-day-september-17-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 13, 2015|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> After his meeting with President Hollande, President Aquino held business meetings with executives from [[Airbus]], [[Schneider Electric]], and [[Teleperformance]].<ref>{{cite news|title=President Aquino meets top French firms in aviation, power, BPO; addresses biz forum|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/business/95658/president-aquino-meets-top-french-firms-in-aviation-power-bpo-addresses-biz-forum|accessdate=October 12, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> He later met with Prime Minister [[Manuel Valls]] at [[Hôtel Matignon]] to discuss the [[Filipinos in France|Filipino community in France]] and their contributions to the [[Economy in France|French economy]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Bilateral Meeting with Prime Minister Manuel Valls|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24258|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 13, 2015|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, the President met with and addressed the Filipino community in France at Chapelle Sainte Bernadette.<ref name="September 17, 2014"/><ref>{{cite news|title=PNoy meets with Pinoys in Paris|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/photo/68056/news/pnoy-meets-with-pinoys-in-paris|accessdate=October 13, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref>
On Thursday, September 18, President Aquino participated in the Philippines–France Business Leaders' Roundtable, where he met with 20 Filipino and French business executives to discuss ways to improve bilateral trade and investment, as well as to promote business opportunities for both countries.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNoy to France: We are more open for business|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/379589/money/economy/pnoy-to-france-we-are-more-open-for-business|accessdate=October 13, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> After, the President addressed the Philippine Business Opportunities Forum at the [[InterContinental Paris Le Grand Hotel]]. In his speech, he urged French businesses to invest in the Philippines, saying that the current state of the [[Economy of the Philippines|Philippine economy]] has been appreciated as a "renaissance" from an economy that was "kept in the darkness of apathy and hopelessness by an administration motivated only by self-service, as opposed to public service."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Esguerra|first1=Christian|title=Aquino woos French businessmen, says PH now enjoying 'renaissance'|url=http://business.inquirer.net/178987/aquino-ph-enjoying-renaissance|accessdate=October 13, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> At the hotel, the President also met with officials from the [[Ayala Corporation]], [[Alstom]]–[[Bouygues]], and the [[Egis Group]] to discuss their expansion plans in the Philippines, having worked on the [[Manila Light Rail Transit System Line 1#South Extension Phase 1 (LRT-1 Extension)|South Extension]] of the [[Manila Light Rail Transit System Line 1]].<ref>{{cite news|author1=[[Natashya Gutierrez]]|title=Aquino to French businessmen: Be part of our story|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69511-paris-aquino-trip-investments|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Business Meeting with Ayala Group & Bouygues-Alstom /EGIS S.A.|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24659|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino later toured the [[Dassault Systèmes#European Headquarters|European Headquarters]] of [[Dassault Systèmes]] in [[Vélizy-Villacoublay]].<ref name="September 18, 2014">{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 18, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/18/the-presidents-day-september-18-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino addressed a forum organized by the [[Institut français des relations internationales]].<ref>{{cite web|title=President Benigno S. Aquino III's Speech during a Forum organized by the French Institute for International Relations (IFRI)|url=http://www.pcoo.gov.ph/speeches2014/speech2014_sep18a.htm|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Operations Office]]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Calica|first1=Aurea|title=Aquino explains strategy on sea dispute with China|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2014/09/20/1371117/aquino-explains-strategy-sea-dispute-china|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> The President also toured the [[Louvre]] later that evening.<ref name="September 18, 2014"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Esguerra|first1=Christian V.|title=Int'l bank proposes peso 'globalization'|url=http://business.inquirer.net/178984/aquino-told-why-not-globalize-peso|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 18, 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Angela Merkel and Benigno Aquino III 9.19.14.jpg|thumb|left|President Aquino converses with German Chancellor Angela Merkel at the balcony of the German Chancellery, overlooking Berlin, on September 19, 2014.]] On Friday, September 19, President Aquino and his delegation departed Paris for Berlin, the last stop of his European trip before heading to the United States. He arrived at [[Berlin Tegel Airport]] at around 10:45 am CEST.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino arrives in Germany|url=http://archive.sunstar.com.ph/breaking-news/2014/09/20/aquino-arrives-germany-366584|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Sun.Star]]|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> From there, the President traveled to the [[German Chancellery]] to meet with [[Chancellor of Germany|Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]], where he was given military honors. During their meeting, Chancellor Merkel agreed to support the Philippines in resolving the territorial disputes in the South China Sea upon President Aquino's request.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Esguerra|first1=Christian|title=German Chancellor Merkel backs PH stance on China row|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/111395/german-chancellor-merkel-urges-china-to-settle-dispute-with-ph-other-countries|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> They also witnessed the signing of bilateral agreements on [[social security]], skills training, and trade, which was followed by a working lunch and a joint press statement.<ref name="September 19, 2014">{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 19, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/19/the-presidents-day-september-19-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Kabiling|first1=Genalyn|title=Aquino-Merkel meet; PH, Germany sign 3 agreements|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/aquino-merkel-meet-ph-germany-sign-3-agreements/|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> After, President Aquino headed to the [[Bellevue Palace (Germany)|Bellevue Palace]] to meet with President [[Joachim Gauck]].<ref>{{cite news|title=From Paris to Berlin: PNoy ends busy sked in France, on last leg of European tour|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/95755/from-paris-to-berlin--pnoy-ends-busy-sked-in-france-on-last-leg-of-european-tour|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> Later that afternoon, President Aquino met with officials from [[SAP SE]],<ref>{{cite news|title=President Aquino to meet top firms, leaders of Germany|url=http://ptvnews.ph/bottom-news-life2/11-11-nation-submenu/38481-president-aquino-to-meet-top-firms-leaders-of-germany|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=PTV News|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]|publisher=[[People's Television Network]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> before addressing a policy forum organized by [[:de:Körber-Stiftung|Körber-Stiftung]] and the Asia-Pacific Committee of German Business.<ref>{{cite web|title=Speech of President Aquino at the policy forum organized with Koerber Stiftung and Asia-Pacific Committee of German Business|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/19/speech-of-president-aquino-at-the-policy-forum-organized-with-koerber-stiftung-and-asia-pacific-committee-of-german-business/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> He later witnessed the signing of a health care agreement between the Ayala Corporation and [[Siemens]] and met with officials from [[Knauf]], [[Investor AB]], [[Saab Group]], and [[Stihl]], as well as former [[Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (Germany)|Federal Minister of Economic Affairs and Energy]] [[Michael Glos]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ceremonial Signing of the Siemens-Qualimed Health Care Agreement|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24531|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Business Meeting with Manfred Grundke and Michael Glos|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24559|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Courtesy Call of Courtesy Call by Marcus Wallenberg and Hakan Bushke|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24561|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Business Meeting with Dr. Rudiger Stihl and Jan Grigor Schubert|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24498|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, the President met with the [[Filipinos in Germany|Filipino community in Germany]].<ref name="September 19, 2014"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Meeting with the Filipino Community|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24579|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref>
On Saturday, September 20, President Aquino visited the Philippine embassy in Berlin, where he was awarded a Freedom Medal from the [[Friedrich Naumann Foundation]] for "his successful reforms in the areas of education, anti-corruption and rule of law."<ref>{{cite web|title=Awarding of the Freedom Medal to the President by the Friedrich Naumann Foundation|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24584|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Medina|first1=Andrei|title=PNoy awarded Freedom Medal in Germany for 'successful reforms'|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/380143/news/nation/pnoy-awarded-freedom-medal-in-germany-for-successful-reforms|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> Before departing Berlin for the United States, the President toured the [[Berlin Hauptbahnhof]] and the [[Berlin Wall#Legacy|Berlin Wall]]. President Aquino and his delegation departed Berlin Tegel Airport at around 6:30 pm CEST, ending his week-long European trip with $2.3 billion worth of investment pledges to the Philippines from 19 European-based companies.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino: Europe trip yields $2.3B in investments|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69749-investments-aquino-europe-trip|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 21, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President Day: September 20, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/20/the-president-day-september-20-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> He arrived at the [[Logan International Airport]] in Boston at approximately 8:33 pm [[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]], beginning his four-day working visit to the United States. It marked the President's first visit to Boston since the [[Assassination of Benigno Aquino, Jr.|assassination]] of his father, former [[Senate of the Philippines|Senator]] [[Benigno Aquino, Jr.]], in 1983 upon returning from [[Benigno Aquino, Jr.#1978 elections, bypass surgery, exile|exile]] in Boston.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dizon|first1=Nikko|title=Aquino arrives in Boston for first visit since '83|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/639665/aquino-arrives-in-boston-for-first-visit-since-83|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 21, 2014}}</ref>
On Sunday, September 21, President Aquino first met with family friends for a private lunch. In the afternoon, he visited [[Boston College]] where he celebrated [[Mass (liturgy)|Mass]] at the college's Parish of St. Ignatius of Loyola and attended a convocation with the local [[Filipino Americans|Filipino-American community]].<ref>{{cite news|title=PNoy visits Boston College|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/photo/68225/news/pnoy-visits-boston-college|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 22, 2014}}</ref> In his speech, the President updated the community on improvements made in the Philippines regarding the economy, education, and liability of officials, among others.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fox|first1=Jeremy C.|title=Philippines president visits Boston College|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2014/09/21/philippines-president-visits-boston-college-making-nostalgic-return-city/milr3Xy8t7xqa8KlS7x7qM/story.html|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[The Boston Globe]]|date=September 21, 2014}}</ref> He also recalled moments from his family's three-year exile in Boston, which he calls his "formative years".<ref>{{cite news|author1=[[Natashya Gutierrez]]|title=Aquino's Boston homecoming nostalgic, emotional|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69825-aquino-boston-homecoming|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 22, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 21, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/21/the-presidents-day-september-21-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 21, 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Benigno Aquino III in Chestnut Hill, MA 9.22.14.jpg|thumb|President Aquino revisits his former residence in Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts on September 22, 2014.]] [[File:Benigno Aquino III delivers speech at John F. Kennedy School of Government 9.22.14.jpg|thumb|President Aquino delivers a speech at a public forum at the John F. Kennedy School of Government in Cambridge, Massachusetts on September 22, 2014.]] On Monday, September 22, President Aquino dined with [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Joseph P. Kennedy III]] at a local pizzeria in [[Newton, Massachusetts|Newton]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dizon|first1=Nikko|title=Aquino meets Kennedy scion|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/640014/aquino-meets-kennedy-scion|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> The President then visited his former neighborhood in [[Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts|Chestnut Hill]], where he visited his former residence, met with its current owner, as well as former neighbors.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dizon|first1=Nikko|title=Aquino visits former home in Boston suburb|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/640011/aquino-visits-former-home-in-boston-suburb|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> Later that afternoon, President Aquino was interviewed by radio journalist [[Jeremy Hobson]] on his program ''[[Here and Now (Boston)|Here and Now]]'' on [[WBUR-FM]], where he was asked on his response to climate change, ahead of the United Nations Climate Summit, and the [[Military activities of ISIL|threat]] of the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Philippine President on Climate Change|url=http://hereandnow.wbur.org/2014/09/23/philippines-president|website=hereandnow.wbur.org|publisher=[[Boston University]]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino delivered a policy speech at the [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]] at [[Harvard University]], where he discussed how the school's teachings shaped the skills of many Filipino politicians in his [[Presidency of Benigno Aquino III|administration]], including several members of his [[Cabinet of the Philippines|Cabinet]], to work towards redeveloping the Philippines from the effects of former President [[Ferdinand Marcos]]'s [[History of the Philippines (1965–86)#The Marcos administration (1965–72)|administration]] with the declaration of [[Proclamation No. 1081|martial law]] to the [[Presidency of Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo|administration]] of his predecessor [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]], saying: "Like [[John F. Kennedy|JFK]], Ninoy, and [[Corazon Aquino|Cory]], each one has the capacity to dream, to die, to live, to fight, to stand for something, to ask 'why not' when the challenges seem insurmountable. Thus can we transform the world for the better."<ref>{{cite web|title=Speech of President Aquino at Harvard University, September 22, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/22/speech-of-president-aquino-at-harvard-university-september-22-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 22, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=Noy bashes GMA in Harvard|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2014/09/23/1372316/noy-bashes-gma-harvard|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> After his speech, President Aquino and his delegation departed Boston for New York City, arriving at the [[Newark Liberty International Airport]] at approximately 8:27 pm EDT, where he was greeted by [[Permanent Representative of the Philippines to the United Nations|Philippine Ambassador to the United Nations]] [[Libran N. Cabactulan]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Santiago|first1=Alvin|title=Arrival in New York CityA.|url=http://www.dwdd.com.ph/2014/09/arrival-in-new-york-u-s-a/|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[DWDD-AM]]|publisher=[[Armed Forces of the Philippines]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 22, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/22/the-presidents-day-september-22-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 22, 2014}}</ref>
On the morning of Tuesday, September 23, President Aquino headed to the [[Headquarters of the United Nations|United Nations Headquarters]] to participate in the United Nations Climate Summit. In his four-minute speech, the President urged the international community to assist the Philippines, a major victim to the effects of climate change being frequently visited by [[Typhoons in the Philippines|typhoons]], in combating climate change through funding and the provision of technology, saying: "We [the Philippines] have never lacked in resolve. What we lack is the access to technology, financing, and investment that would allow us to accelerate our strategy."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Macaraig|first1=Ayee|title=Aquino to UN: PH needs climate funds, technology|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69970-aquino-climate-summit-speech|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Speech of President Aquino at the UN Climate Change Summit 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/23/speech-of-president-aquino-at-the-un-climate-change-summit-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> Following the summit, President Aquino participated in a round table discussion with business executives from the [[United States Chamber of Commerce|U.S. Chamber of Commerce]], the [[US-ASEAN Business Council]], and the US-Philippines Society to discuss economic expansion and investment in the Philippines.<ref>{{cite web|title=Business Roundtable with CEOs and Senior Officials|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24865|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Tangi|first1=Rocelle|title=President Aquino tackles climate change, trade relations during US trip|url=http://asianjournal.com/news/president-aquino-tackles-climate-change-trade-relations-during-us-trip/|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=Asian Journal|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> Later that day, President Aquino participated in the [[Columbia University#World Leaders Forum|World Leaders Forum]] at the [[Low Memorial Library]] of [[Columbia University]], where he delivered a speech and answered questions from the audience. In his speech, the President spoke on the importance of reforms to address challenges faced constantly by the Philippines.<ref>{{cite web|title=Policy Speech at Word Leaders Forum|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24859|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 15, 2015|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> While answering an audience member's question, President Aquino was interrupted by at least three protesters who demanded a response from the President regarding alleged acts of impunity in the Philippines and corruption over [[Humanitarian response to Typhoon Haiyan|Typhoon Haiyan aid]]. President Aquino refused to respond and [[List of Presidents of Columbia University|Columbia University President]] [[Lee Bollinger]] apologized over the incident.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tan|first1=Kimberly Jane|title=Activists disrupt PNoy talk at Columbia University|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/380581/news/nation/activists-disrupt-pnoy-talk-at-columbia-university|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Macaraig|first1=Ayee|title=Protesters interrupt Aquino forum at US university|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/69987-aquino-columbia-university-forum-protest|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: September 23, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/09/24/the-presidents-day-september-23-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 14, 2015|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref>
On the last day of his trip, Wednesday, September 24, President Aquino and his delegation departed Newark and traveled across the United States for a brief visit to San Francisco, the last stop of his working visit to the United States. He arrived at [[San Francisco International Airport]] at approximately 9:38 am [[Pacific Time Zone|PDT]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Arrival at San Francisco International Airport|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=24877|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 15, 2015|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref> In San Francisco, President Aquino held business meetings with senior officials from [[Caesars Entertainment Corporation]], International Development, and [[Wells Fargo]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino's last stop in the US met with protests from FilAm activists|url=http://www.balitangamerica.tv/aquinos-last-stop-in-the-us-met-with-protests-from-filam-activists/|accessdate=October 15, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref> Outside the Wells Fargo headquarters on [[Haight Street]], President Aquino was met by protesters from Filipino-American communities in California, the largest of Filipino-American communities in the United States, who were disappointed by the President's decision to decline their invitation and prioritize business meetings, instead of meeting with the community. President Aquino and his delegation departed San Francisco for Manila at around 4:40 pm PDT, ending his 10-day trip to Europe and the United States.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tangi|first1=Rocelle|title=Aquino concludes US visit with stop at San Francisco's Haight Street|url=http://asianjournal.com/news/aquino-concludes-us-visit-with-stop-at-san-franciscos-haight-street/|accessdate=October 15, 2015|work=Asian Journal|date=September 25, 2014}}</ref>
===Indonesia (October 9–10)=== President Aquino attended the 7th Bali Democracy Forum in [[Nusa Dua]], [[Bali]]. He, along with Indonesian President [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]], co-chaired the forum aimed at reinforcing democracy in the region.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/aquino-to-attend-democracy-forum-in-indonesia | title= Aquino to attend Bali Democracy Forum |publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=October 8, 2014 | accessdate=October 8, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Esguerra|first1=Christian V.|last2=Calleja|first2=Niña|title=Aquino co-chairs Bali forum|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/112277/aquino-arrives-in-bali-for-democracy-forum|accessdate=October 3, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=October 10, 2014}}</ref> On the sidelines of the forum, President Aquino was awarded the [[Orders, decorations, and medals of Indonesia#Bintang Republik Indonesia ("Star of the Republic of Indonesia")|Bintang Republik Indonesia Adipurna]] ("Star of the Republic of Indonesia") by President Yudhoyono, the highest award honored by the [[Government of Indonesia]], becoming the first Filipino to receive such award.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=Indonesia to bestow highest gov't award on Aquino|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2014/10/09/1378281/indonesia-bestow-highest-govt-award-aquino|accessdate=October 3, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
===China and Myanmar (November 9–13)=== President Aquino traveled to Beijing to attend the [[APEC China 2014|26th]] [[APEC Summit]] (November 9–11) and [[Naypyidaw]] to attend the 25th [[ASEAN Summit]] and the [[Ninth East Asia Summit]] (November 11–13).<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/98818/apec-asean-agenda--pnoy-flies-out-sunday-for-key-meetings-on-asian-seas-connectivity-reforms | title=APEC, ASEAN AGENDA: PNoy flies out Sunday for key meetings on Asian seas, connectivity, reforms | publisher=''[[InterAksyon.com]]'' | date=November 8, 2014 | accessdate=November 8, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/387681/news/world/stalled-reforms-south-china-sea-to-dominate-myanmar-s-asean-party | title=Stalled reforms, South China Sea to dominate Myanmar's ASEAN party | publisher=[[GMA News]] | date=November 12, 2014 |accessdate=November 12, 2014}}</ref> The summit meetings were a chance for President Aquino to share the Philippines' plans to contribute to [[economic integration]] and regional growth, as well as the country's eagerness to tackle global issues, including [[human trafficking]] and pollution.<ref>{{cite news|title=Information: President Benigno S. Aquino III off to Myanmar for the 25th ASEAN Summit|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/information-president-benigno-s-aquino-iii-off-to-myanmar-for-the-25th-asean-summit/|accessdate=September 28, 2015|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref> The government spent ₱24 million on the trip.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sabillo|first1=Kristine Angeli|title=Gov't spends P24 million on Aquino's Apec, Asean meetings|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/649678/govt-spends-p24m-on-aquinos-apec-asean-trip|accessdate=September 29, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=November 9, 2014}}</ref>
On Sunday, November 9, President Aquino arrived at the [[Beijing Capital International Airport]] at around 1:20 pm [[China Standard Time|CST]].<ref>{{cite web|title=President Aquino arrives in Beijing for the 22nd APEC Leaders' Summit|url=http://www.bcs.gov.ph/index.php/10-latest/1759-president-aquino-arrives-in-beijing-for-the-22nd-apec-leaders-summit|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Group]]|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 9, 2014}}</ref> In Beijing, he first headed to the [[China National Convention Center]] to attend the APEC CEO Summit, where he addressed business leaders on the economic growth of the Philippines through economic reforms and innovation.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino attends APEC CEO Summit in Beijing; govt spends P24M for APEC, ASEAN meetings|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/98861/aquino-attends-apec-ceo-summit-in-beijing-govt-spends-p24m-for-apec-asean-meetings|accessdate=September 29, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|date=November 9, 2014}}</ref> He also emphasized the country's transition from being called the "Sick Man of Asia" to "[[Tiger Cub Economies|Asia's Rising Tiger]]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Message of President Aquino at the APEC CEO Summit 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/09/message-of-president-aquino-at-the-apec-ceo-summit-2014-2/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 9, 2014}}</ref> He then met with Vietnamese President [[Trương Tấn Sang]] at the Philippine embassy in Beijing, where the two presidents developed an agenda for a [[strategic partnership]] that would improve economic and social ties.<ref>{{cite news|title=Philippines, Vietnam to jumpstart talks on strategic partnership|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/98953/philippines-vietnam-to-jumpstart-talks-on-strategic-partnership|accessdate=September 29, 2015|work=[[News5]]|publisher=[[TV5 Network, Inc.]]|date=November 11, 2014|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]}}</ref> In the evening, the President met with [[Moody's Corporation]] CEO [[Raymond W. McDaniel Jr.]], where they discussed efforts on preventing the [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa|Ebola virus epidemic]] from reaching the Philippines and rehabilitation efforts on [[Typhoon Haiyan|Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda)]]. The President also met with executives from [[Sanofi]] and [[Johnson & Johnson]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 9, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/09/the-presidents-day-november-9-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 9, 2014}}</ref> [[File:Hassanal, Aquino, Putin at APEC China 2014 11.10.14.jpg|thumb|President Aquino participates in the APEC Leaders' family photo at the APEC Leaders' Meeting in Beijing on November 10, 2014.]] On Monday, November 10, President Aquino returned to the Philippine embassy in Beijing to hold a series of bilateral meetings with Canadian Prime Minister [[Stephen Harper]], Thai Prime Minister [[Prayut Chan-o-cha]], New Zealand Prime Minister [[John Key]], and Papuan Prime Minister [[Peter O'Neill]]. With Prime Minister Harper, the two heads of government discussed rehabilitation efforts on Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda) and the Philippines' status in [[Canada's Global Markets Action Plan]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Prime Minister Stephen Harper meets with President Benigno Aquino III of the Philippines|url=http://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2014/11/10/prime-minister-stephen-harper-meets-president-benigno-aquino-iii-philippines|publisher=[[Prime Minister of Canada]]|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref> With Prime Minister Prayut, the two heads of government discussed strengthening economic ties between the Philippines and Thailand, particularly on supporting [[small and medium-sized enterprises]] and local farmers.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bilateral Meeting with Thai Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-o-cha|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=25770|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref> With Prime Minister Key, the two heads of government discussed rehabilitation efforts on Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda) and the expansion of air routes between New Zealand and the Philippines. The President also thanked the Prime Minister for New Zealand's support for the [[Peace process with the Bangsamoro in the Philippines|peace process]] with [[Bangsamoro (political entity)|Bangsamoro]].<ref>{{cite web|title=President Aquino thanks New Zealand for its support for the Mindanao Peace Process|url=http://www.bcs.gov.ph/index.php/10-latest/1761-president-aquino-thanks-new-zealand-for-its-support-for-the-mindanao-peace-process|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Group]]|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref> With Prime Minister O'Neill, the two heads of government discussed the enhancement of cooperation between Papua New Guinea and the Philippines on trade, investment, health services, and agriculture.<ref>{{cite web|title=Philippines, Papua New Guinea to enhance trade and investment cooperation|url=http://www.bcs.gov.ph/index.php/10-latest/1760-philippines-papua-new-guinea-to-enhance-trade-and-investment-cooperation|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Group]]|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref> In the afternoon, President Aquino attended the [[Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation#APEC Business Advisory Council|APEC Business Advisory Council]]. In the evening, the President joined the other APEC leaders in attending the APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting Welcome Dinner at the [[Beijing National Aquatics Center]], hosted by Chinese President [[Xi Jinping]] and [[Spouse of the President of the People's Republic of China|First Lady]] [[Peng Liyuan]]. For the occasion, the President and the other APEC leaders wore a modified version of the [[Mao suit]], as part of the APEC tradition of the leaders wearing the host nation's traditional outfit.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Diola|first1=Camille|title=Why Aquino, Putin wore 'Star Trek' tunics at APEC|url=http://www.philstar.com/news-feature/2014/11/11/1390622/why-aquino-putin-wore-star-trek-tunics-apec|accessdate=September 29, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=November 11, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 10, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/10/the-presidents-day-november-10-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 29, 2015|date=November 10, 2014}}</ref>
On the morning of Tuesday, November 11, President Aquino and the other APEC leaders participated in the APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting Retreat at the International Conference Center in [[:zh:雁栖湖|Yanqi Lake]], where he was given the chance to share the Philippines' views on advancing economic integration to promote economic growth, infrastructure development, and innovation, among others.<ref>{{cite web|title=Participation of President Benigno S. Aquino III to the 22nd APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting (AELM) Beijing, People's Republic of China 9-11 November 2014|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=25388|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=September 30, 2015|date=November 11, 2014}}</ref> After, the APEC leaders participated in a tree planting ceremony at the Summer Garden, outside the International Conference Center. After the ceremony, President Aquino met briefly with President Xi for a ten-minute discussion regarding the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]], in which both presidents agreed to resolve the disputes in "constructive ways".<ref>{{cite news|title=APEC leaders plant trees at Beijing venue|url=http://english.cntv.cn/2014/11/11/VIDE1415714523060555.shtml|accessdate=September 30, 2015|publisher=[[China Central Television]]|date=November 11, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Esmaquel II|first1=Paterno|title=Aquino: Philippines willing to 'listen' to China|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/74812-aquino-xi-jinping-listen-china|accessdate=September 30, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=November 12, 2014}}</ref> In the afternoon, President Aquino and the other APEC leaders participated in the second session of the meeting, before attending a working lunch. In the evening, President Aquino departed Beijing and arrived at the [[Naypyidaw International Airport]] in Myanmar at around 11:05 pm [[Myanmar Standard Time|MST]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 11, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/11/the-presidents-day-november-11-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 30, 2015|date=November 11, 2014}}</ref>
On Wednesday, November 12, President Aquino first attended the opening ceremony of the 25th ASEAN Summit, before attending the plenary session at around 10:15 am MST, where the President was given the chance to share his views on political security and sociocultural development in the region.<ref name="November 12, 2014">{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 12, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/12/the-presidents-day-november-12-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 30, 2015|date=November 12, 2014}}</ref> During the session, President Aquino also urged the finalization of a code of conduct to resolve the territorial disputes in the South China Sea.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tubadeza|first1=Kathryn|title=PNoy pushes anew for Code of Conduct in South China Sea|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/387802/news/nation/pnoy-pushes-anew-for-code-of-conduct-in-south-china-sea|accessdate=October 2, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network, Inc.]]|date=November 12, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author1=[[Natashya Gutierrez]]|title=Aquino goes soft on China in ASEAN Summit|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/74875-aquino-asean-gentle-reminders-china|accessdate=October 2, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> In the afternoon, President Aquino and the other [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] leaders participated in a series of summits with the leaders of neighboring nations to further enhance cooperation between ASEAN and the said neighboring nations, beginning with the 12th ASEAN–India Summit with Prime Minister [[Narendra Modi]], followed by the 17th ASEAN–Japan Summit with Prime Minister [[Shinzō Abe]],<ref>{{cite web|title=17th Japan-ASEAN Summit Meeting|url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/a_o/rp/page3e_000260.html|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs]]|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 12, 2014}}</ref> and concluding with the 40th ASEAN–Australia Commemorative Summit with Prime Minister [[Tony Abbott]].<ref>{{cite news|title=ASEAN-Australia 40th Anniversary Commemorative Summit|url=http://www.akp.gov.kh/?p=53893|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014|agency=[[Agence Kampuchea Press]]}}</ref> In between, the ASEAN leaders also attended the 6th ASEAN–United Nations Summit with [[Secretary-General of the United Nations|Secretary-General]] [[Ban Ki-moon]], where the Secretary-General urged ASEAN leaders to renew their commitment to addressing issues regarding peace and security.<ref>{{cite web|title=Addressing ASEAN-United Nations Summit, Secretary-General Calls for Renewed Commitment to Peace, Security|url=https://www.un.org/press/en/2014/sgsm16334.doc.htm|publisher=United Nations|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 12, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, the ASEAN leaders attended a gala dinner hosted by President [[Thein Sein]] and First Lady Khin Khin Win.<ref name="November 12, 2014"/> [[File:Benigno Aquino III at Ninth East Asia Summit 11.13.14.jpg|thumb|left|President Aquino participates in the plenary session of the Ninth East Asia Summit in Naypyidaw on November 13, 2014.]] On Thursday, November 13, President Aquino attended the Ninth East Asia Summit Plenary Session, where the President was given the chance to share his views on issues regarding peace and stability, climate change, and the spread of pandemic diseases, as well as ways to further enhance Asia-Pacific economic integration.<ref>{{cite web|title=9th East Asia Summit Plenary Session|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=26104|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino and the other ASEAN leaders later participated in the 2nd ASEAN–United States Summit with President [[Barack Obama]], aimed at enhancing cooperation between ASEAN and the United States to maintain regional peace and stability.<ref name="November 13, 2014">{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 13, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/14/the-presidents-day-november-13-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> After, the ASEAN leaders participated in the 17th ASEAN–China Summit with [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] [[Li Keqiang]], where discussions focused on reinforcing ASEAN–China relations despite the ongoing territorial disputes in the South China Sea between China and a number of ASEAN nations.<ref>{{cite news|author1=Zhang Dan|title=Premier Li improves prospects of China-ASEAN relationship|url=http://english.cntv.cn/2014/11/18/ARTI1416299817197110.shtml|accessdate=October 2, 2015|publisher=[[China Central Television]]|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino then met with Indian Prime Minister Modi, where the two presidents discussed mutual interests on the ASEAN–India Free Trade Agreement and the information technology and [[business process management]] sectors, as well as India's support over a peaceful resolution on the South China Sea territorial disputes.<ref>{{cite web|title=President Aquino and Prime Minister Modi of India hold bilateral meeting|url=http://www.bcs.gov.ph/index.php/10-latest/1778-president-aquino-and-prime-minister-modi-of-india-hold-bilateral-meeting|publisher=[[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Group]]|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> Later that afternoon, the ASEAN leaders joined Chinese Premier Li, Japanese Prime Minister Abe, and South Korean President [[Park Geun-hye]] at the 17th ASEAN Plus Three Summit to discuss enhancing the cooperation between ASEAN and China, Japan, and South Korea.<ref>{{cite web|title=The 17th ASEAN Plus Three (Japan-China-Republic of Korea) Summit|url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/a_o/rp/page22e_000622.html|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs]]|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> The ASEAN leaders also attended ASEAN Leaders' Meeting with ASEAN Business Advisory Council, an opportunity for ASEAN nations to be given feedback from the council and guidance to achieve economic integration.<ref>{{cite web|title=ASEAN Leaders' Meeting with ASEAN Business Advisory Council (ABAC)|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?tag=asean-leaders-meeting-with-asean-business-advisory-council-abac|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=October 2, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, the ASEAN leaders attended the closing ceremony of the 25th ASEAN Summit.<ref>{{cite news|title=25th ASEAN Summit closes in Myanmar|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/photo/2014-11/14/c_133788614.htm|accessdate=October 2, 2015|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|date=November 14, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino then headed to the Naypyidaw International Airport, where he was greeted by [[Overseas Filipinos]] in Myanmar before departing for Manila. He departed Naypyidaw at around 8:30 pm MST.<ref name="November 13, 2014"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Pazzibugan|first1=Dona Z.|title=Aquino leaves Myanmar Thursday night|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/114320/aquino-leaves-myanmar-thursday-night|accessdate=October 2, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref>
===Singapore (November 18–19)=== [[File:Benigno Aquino III and Daniel Franklin in Singapore 11.18.14.jpg|thumb|''The Economist'' Executive Editor Daniel Franklin interviewing President Aquino at ''The Economist'''s "The World in 2015" Gala Dinner in Singapore on November 18, 2015.]] President Aquino traveled to Singapore for a two-day working visit that cost ₱11.6 million.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Calonzo|first1=Andreo|title=PNoy's Singapore trip to cost P11.6M|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/388564/news/nation/pnoy-s-singapore-trip-to-cost-p11-6m|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|publisher=[[GMA Network]]|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> He arrived at [[Singapore Changi Airport|Changi Airport]] at 11:28 am [[Singapore Standard Time|SST]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tarra|first1=Quismundo|title=Aquino arrives in Singapore|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/114508/aquino-arrives-in-singapore-2|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> After arriving, President Aquino headed to the [[Istana (Singapore)|Istana]] to meet with Prime Minister [[Lee Hsien Loong]] and President [[Tony Tan Keng Yam]], the latter of whom hosted a luncheon for President Aquino.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Harley|first1=Dean|last2=Navales|first2=Ruth|title=Pres. Aquino, nasa Singapore para sa kanyang 2-day working visit|url=http://www.untvweb.com/news/pres-aquino-nasa-singapore-para-sa-kanyang-2-day-working-visit/|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=UNTVweb.com|publisher=[[Progressive Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino attended ''[[The Economist]]'''s "The World in 2015" Gala Dinner as a keynote speaker. During his interview with executive editor Daniel Franklin regarding his predictions for the following year, the President discussed his [[Presidency of Benigno Aquino III#Domestic policies|domestic]] and [[Presidency of Benigno Aquino III#Foreign policies|foreign policies]], his recent meeting with Chinese President [[Xi Jinping]], the Philippines' interest in joining the [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]], and the Philippine government's efforts in re-establishing damaged areas caused by [[Typhoon Haiyan|Super Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda)]].<ref>{{cite news|title=WATCH: Aquino answers questions from The Economist|url=http://www.philstar.com:8080/news-videos/2014/11/19/1393534/watch-aquino-answers-questions-economist|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=November 19, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 18, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/18/the-presidents-day-november-18-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 26, 2015|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> The following day, President Aquino met with business executives at a [[Round table (discussion)|roundtable discussion]] organized by the Philippine Trade and Investment Center and the Singapore Business Federation, where he urged executives to invest in the Philippines, citing a 6.3 percent growth in GDP from 2010 to 2014 as a form of conviction.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tangi|first1=Rocelle|title=Aquino urges business leaders to invest in PH|url=http://asianjournal.com/news/aquino-urges-business-leaders-to-invest-in-ph/|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=Asian Journal|date=November 18, 2014}}</ref> He also met with executives from the [[SIA Engineering Company]], [[Temasek Holdings]], [[Keppel Corporation]], and [[GIC Private Limited]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Quismundo|first1=Tarra|title=Business meetings, Jollibee visit up for Aquino Wednesday in Singapore|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/114537/business-meetings-jollibee-visit-up-for-aquino-wednesday-in-singapore|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=November 19, 2014}}</ref> In the afternoon, the President dined at a [[Jollibee]] branch at [[Lucky Plaza]], where he was met by a crowd of [[Filipinos in Singapore|Filipinos]],<ref>{{cite news|last1=Viray|first1=Patricia Lourdes|title=PNoy orders Yum with cheese at Jollibee Singapore|url=http://www.philstar.com/news-feature/2014/11/19/1393540/pnoy-orders-yum-cheese-jollibee-singapore|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=November 19, 2014}}</ref> before departing Singapore for Manila at around 3:10 pm SST.<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: November 19, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/11/19/the-presidents-day-november-19-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 26, 2015|date=November 19, 2014}}</ref>
===South Korea (December 11–12)=== President Aquino traveled to South Korea to attend the two-day 25th [[ASEAN–Republic of Korea Commemorative Summit]] in [[Busan]]. He initially canceled the trip in order to assist his country from the effects of [[Typhoon Hagupit (2014)|Typhoon Hagupit (Ruby)]], but later decided to push through with the trip after being satisfied with the government's efforts and would instead monitor the situation from Busan.<ref>{{cite news | title=PNoy to push through with Korea trip | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/12/09/14/pnoy-push-through-korea-trip | publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]] | date=December 9, 2014 | accessdate=December 10, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title=PNoy visit to South Korea on again as storm departs | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/391895/news/nation/pnoy-visit-to-south-korea-on-again-as-storm-departs | accessdate=December 10, 2014 | publisher=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]] | date=December 10, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino in Busan to attend ASEAN-South Korea Summit|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/aquino-leaves-for-busan-to-attend-asean-south-korea-summit/|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|agency=[[Philippines News Agency]]|date=December 11, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino arrived at [[Gimhae Air Base]] at around 1:40 pm [[Korea Standard Time|KST]]. On the sidelines of the summit, the President met with President [[Park Geun-hye]]. According to [[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Operations Offic]]e Secretary Sonny Coloma, who accompanied him during the trip, President Aquino announced his intention to form a "comprehensive strategic partnership" that would further boost [[Philippines–South Korea relations]] during their bilateral meeting. The two presidents also discussed issues regarding regional security, education, and the safety of [[Koreans in the Philippines|South Koreans in the Philippines]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Gutierrez|first1=Natashya|title=Aquino proposes comprehensive PH-ROK strategic partnership|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/77873-aquino-south-korea-trip-2014|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=December 12, 2014}}</ref> President Aquino also held a bilateral meeting with Malaysian Prime Minister [[Najib Razak]].<ref>{{cite news|author1=Ahmad Fuad Yahya|title=Najib meets Aquino in Busan|url=http://dev.nst.com.my/news/najib-meets-aquino-busan|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[New Straits Times]]|agency=[[Bernama]]|date=December 11, 2014}}</ref> After, the President joined President Park and the other nine [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] leaders in viewing a traditional [[Korean art|Korean arts and crafts]] exhibit at the [[Busan Exhibition and Convention Center]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Experience in Korean Traditional Arts and Crafts Exhibition|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=26932|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=September 26, 2015|date=December 11, 2014}}</ref> before attending a dinner and cultural performance hosted by President Park.<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: December 11, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/12/11/the-presidents-day-december-11-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 26, 2015|date=December 11, 2014}}</ref>
The following day, at around 9:30 am KST, President Aquino attended the first Commemorative Summit session chaired by South Korea, which focused on the multilateral cooperation between the ASEAN countries and South Korea. At around 10:50 am KST, the President attended the second Commemorative Summit session chaired by , which focused on security cooperation, [[climate change]], and [[emergency management]]. After the summit, President Aquino and the other ASEAN leaders attended a luncheon hosted by President Park. Before departing for Manila, President Aquino inspected one of the 12 [[KAI T-50 Golden Eagle]] aircraft that the Philippines had purchased from the [[Korea Aerospace Industries]] at the tarmac of Gimhae Air Base.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino checks fighter jets to be acquired from S. Korea|url=http://archive.sunstar.com.ph/breaking-news/2014/12/12/aquino-checks-fighter-jets-be-acquired-s-korea-381668|accessdate=September 26, 2015|work=[[Sun.star]]|date=December 12, 2014}}</ref> The President departed Gimhae Air Base at around 5:20 pm KST.<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: December 12, 2014|url=http://www.gov.ph/2014/12/12/the-presidents-day-december-12-2014/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 26, 2015|date=December 12, 2014}}</ref>
==2015==
In 2015, President Aquino made 8 official visits.
===Malaysia (April 26–28)=== President Aquino attended the 26th [[ASEAN Summit]] in Kuala Lumpur and [[Langkawi]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Naguit|first1=Roices|title=PNoy flying to KL for ASEAN Summit; state visit to Canada also slated|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/109399/pnoy-flying-to-kl-for-asean-summit-state-visit-to-canada-also-slated|accessdate=April 25, 2015|publisher=[[News5]]|date=April 24, 2015}}</ref>
===United States and Canada (May 6–9)=== In April 2015, [[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)#Presidential Spokesman|Deputy Presidential Spokeswoman]] [[Abigail Valte]] announced that President Aquino would embark on a three-day state visit to Canada from May 7 to 9, 2015, accepting the invitation from [[Governor General of Canada|Governor General]] [[David Johnston]], along with a brief working visit to Chicago in the United States beforehand and a state visit to Japan in June.<ref name="Noy to visit Canada, Japan">{{cite news|last1=Calica|first1=Aurea|title=Noy to visit Canada, Japan|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/04/25/1447624/noy-visit-canada-japan|accessdate=April 25, 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=April 24, 2015}}</ref><ref name="Aquino leaves for US, Canada">{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=Aquino leaves for US, Canada|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/05/06/1451819/aquino-leaves-us-canada|accessdate=May 6, 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=May 6, 2015}}</ref>
On Wednesday, May 6, President Aquino arrived at the [[Chicago O'Hare International Airport]] at approximately 1:14 pm [[Central Time Zone|CT]] to begin his four-day North American trip.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=Aquino arrives in Chicago, receives citation from mayor|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/05/07/1452166/aquino-arrives-chicago-receives-citation-mayor|accessdate=September 25, 2015|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref> He then headed to the [[JW Marriott Hotels|JW Marriott Chicago]], where he was met by [[Mayor of Chicago|Mayor]] [[Rahm Emanuel]], who presented him with a [[Chicago City Council]] Resolution.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Burgonio|first1=TJ|title=In Chicago, Aquino meets newly-reelected mayor|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/122539/in-chicago-aquino-meets-newly-reelected-mayor|accessdate=September 25, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref> After, the President headed to the [[TransUnion]] headquarters to attend a [[Round table (discussion)|round table discussion]] with representatives from the [[United States Chamber of Commerce|U.S. Chamber of Commerce]], the [[US-ASEAN Business Council]], and the National Center for [[APEC]].<ref>{{cite news|title=TransUnion Hosts Philippine President Benigno Aquino III at Its Corporate Headquarters|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/07/idUSnMKW23V78a+1c8+MKW20150507|accessdate=September 25, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref> During the discussion, several executives of United States firms expressed interest in investing in the Philippines, praising the country's economic growth and development and the "competence and talent" of Filipino workers.<ref>{{cite news|title=US firms express interest in PH investments|url=http://www.rappler.com/business/economy-watch/92479-us-businessmen-investments-philippines|accessdate=September 25, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino met with the [[Demographics of Filipino Americans#Illinois|Filipino community in Chicago]] at the JW Marriott Chicago, where he also addressed an economic update on the Philippines, citing a 6.3 percent increase in GDP, a 479 percent increase in foreign investment from 2010 to 2014, and the country's ranking improvements in the [[World Bank Group]]'s [[Ease of doing business index]] and the [[World Economic Forum]]'s ''[[Global Competitiveness Report]]'', among others.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino: The Philippines is now the 'Darling of Asia'|url=http://www.rappler.com/business/economy-watch/92466-aquino-philippines-darling-asia|accessdate=September 25, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: May 6, 2015|url=http://www.gov.ph/2015/05/06/the-presidents-day-may-6-2015/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=September 25, 2015|date=May 6, 2015}}</ref> [[File:Benigno Aquino III at Rideau Hall welcome ceremony in Ottawa 5.7.15.jpg|thumb|President Aquino delivers remarks during the welcome ceremony hosted by Governor General Johnston at the Rideau Hall in Ottawa on May 7, 2015.]] On Thursday, May 7, President Aquino departed Chicago in the morning and arrived at [[Ottawa Macdonald–Cartier International Airport|Macdonald–Cartier International Airport]] in Ottawa at approximately 12:10 pm [[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]], beginning his four-day state visit to Canada.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Andrada|first1=Teresa|title=PNoy arrives in Ottawa for state visit to Canada|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/483654/news/nation/pnoy-arrives-in-ottawa-for-state-visit-to-canada|accessdate=June 9, 2015|publisher=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref> After his arrival, the President arrived at an official welcome ceremony with military honors on a [[Landau (carriage)|landau]] driven by the [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] at [[Rideau Hall]], where he was met by Governor General Johnston and his wife [[Sharon Johnston|Sharon]]. After the ceremony, President Aquino paid a courtesy call to Governor General Johnston inside Rideau Hall. During their meeting, Governor General Johnston praised President Aquino for [[Presidency of Benigno Aquino III#Administration and cabinet|his administration]]'s efforts in contributing to the Philippines' [[Economy of the Philippines|economic growth]], to which the President cited [[good governance]], the [[Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program]], and [[:wikt:backlog|backlog]]-clearing programs, while the President thanked Governor General Johnston for Canada's efforts in aiding the victims of [[Typhoon Haiyan|Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda)]] and their advocation for the [[Bangsamoro (political entity)|Bangsamoro]] [[Peace process with the Bangsamoro in the Philippines|peace process]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino pays courtesy call on Canada's Governor General|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/aquino-pays-courtesy-call-on-canadas-governor-general/182034/|accessdate=June 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Manila Times]]''|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref> After the meeting, President Aquino participated in a ceremonial planting of a [[Picea rubens|red spruce]] outside Rideau Hall, which is adjacent to the [[Acer rubrum|red maple]] planted by his mother, former President [[Corazon Aquino]], during her visit in 1989. In the evening, the Johnstons hosted a state dinner for President Aquino.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino gets traditional welcome in Canada; Cory remembered|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/122635/aquino-gets-traditional-welcome-in-canada-cory-remembered|accessdate=June 11, 2015|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]''|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=PNoy meets Canada governor general, plants symbolic tree like Cory|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/05/08/1452553/pnoy-meets-canada-governor-general-plants-symbolic-tree-cory|accessdate=June 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: May 7, 2015|url=http://www.gov.ph/2015/05/07/the-presidents-day-may-7-2015/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=June 11, 2015|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref> [[File:Benigno Aquino III and Stephen Harper in Toronto 5.8.15.jpg|thumb|left|President Aquino and Prime Minister Harper attend a reception with the Filipino community in Toronto on May 8, 2015.]] On Friday, May 8, President Aquino met with Prime Minister [[Stephen Harper]] at the [[Centre Block]] of [[Parliament Hill]]. At their bilateral meeting, the two heads of government discussed the regional developments on the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]], the safety of the [[Overseas Filipino|Overseas Filipino Workers]] in Canada, and trade between Canada and the Philippines. President Aquino and Prime Minister Harper witnessed the signing of several bilateral agreements on labor, trade, and development, before attending a joint press conference, followed by a tour of the [[Library of Parliament]].<ref>{{cite web|title=PM delivers remarks during a joint press conference with Benigno Aquino III, President of the Philippines|url=http://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2015/05/08/pm-delivers-remarks-during-joint-press-conference-benigno-aquino-iii-president|publisher=[[Office of the Prime Minister (Canada)|Office of the Prime Minister]]|accessdate=June 12, 2015|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Philippines and Canada to launch free-trade talks|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/92630-canada-philippines-free-trade-talks|accessdate=June 11, 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[Rappler]]|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Bacani|first1=Louis|title=Aquino, Canada PM to discuss South China Sea row|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2015/04/29/1449241/aquino-canada-pm-discuss-south-china-sea-row|accessdate=June 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]''|date=April 29, 2015}}</ref> Prime Minister Harper hosted a working luncheon for President Aquino, before the latter headed to Macdonald–Cartier International Airport to depart for [[Toronto]]. President Aquino arrived at [[Toronto Pearson International Airport]] at 2:28 pm EDT and headed to the [[Fairmont Royal York]] to attend a [[Round table (discussion)|round table]] business meeting with the [[Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada]], where opportunities for trade and investment between Canadian and Filipino businesses were discussed.<ref>{{cite web|title=APF Canada Hosts CEO Roundtable with Philippines President|url=https://www.asiapacific.ca/media/news-releases/45574|publisher=[[Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada]]|accessdate=June 12, 2015|date=May 7, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Arrival in Toronto, Canada|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=29745|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=June 12, 2015|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref> Prime Minister Harper, who had traveled to Toronto, hosted a reception at [[Roy Thomson Hall]] for President Aquino to meet with over 2,000 members of the [[Filipino Canadian|Filipino community in Canada]]. During his remarks, President Aquino addressed to the Filipino community a progress report on the economic growth of the Philippines, stating a 6.3 percent increase in GDP and 1.04 million jobs filled in 2014. With these statistics, he also added that the Philippines had transformed from "the sick man of Asia" to "the darling of Asia."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Roque|first1=Marisa|title=2,000 Fil-Canadians cheer Pres. Aquino in Toronto|url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/122714/2000-fil-canadians-cheer-pres-aquino-in-toronto|accessdate=June 12, 2015|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]''|date=May 10, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Reception hosted by Prime Minister Stephen Harper in honor of President Benigno S. Aquino III and the Filipino Community|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=29889|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=June 12, 2015|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref> In the evening, the President headed back to the Fairmont Royal York to meet with [[Justin Trudeau]], leader of the [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal Party]], and [[Ontario]] [[Premier of Ontario|Premier]] [[Kathleen Wynne]].<ref>{{cite news|title=PHOTOS: PNoy in Canada [Days 2–3]|url=http://www.canadianinquirer.net/2015/05/10/photos-pnoy-in-canada-days-2-3/|accessdate=June 13, 2015|publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Philippine Canadian Inquirer]]''|date=May 10, 2015}}</ref> He also held a coffee meeting with the Filipino media.<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: May 8, 2015|url=http://www.gov.ph/2015/05/08/the-presidents-day-may-8-2015/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=June 13, 2015|date=May 8, 2015}}</ref>
On Saturday, May 9, President Aquino departed Toronto for [[Vancouver]], the final stop of his three-day state visit to Canada, as well as his four-day visit to North America. The President and his delegation arrived at [[Vancouver International Airport]] past noon, where he was welcomed by [[Minister of National Defence (Canada)|Minister of National Defence]] and [[Minister of Multiculturalism and Citizenship (Canada)|Multiculturalism and Citizenship]] [[Jason Kenney]] and [[British Columbia]] [[Attorney General of British Columbia|Attorney General]] [[Suzanne Anton]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Andrada|first1=Teresa|title=PNoy in Vancouver for last leg of Canada state visit|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/484714/news/nation/pnoy-in-vancouver-for-last-leg-of-canada-state-visit|accessdate=June 13, 2015|publisher=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|date=May 10, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Arrival in Vancouver, Canada|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=29804|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=June 13, 2015|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref> After arriving, President Aquino headed to the [[Pan Pacific Hotels and Resorts|Pan Pacific Vancouver Hotel]] to meet with British Columbia [[Premier of British Columbia|Premier]] [[Christy Clark]], where they also witnessed the signing of a [[memorandum of understanding]] between [[Secretary of Labor and Employment (Philippines)|Philippine Labor and Employment Secretary]] [[Rosalinda Baldoz]] and British Columbia International Trade Minister [[Teresa Wat]], aimed at strengthening the employment abilities of Filipinos in British Columbia, as well as their protection.<ref>{{cite web|title=Signing Ceremony and Meet and Greet with Premier Christy Clark|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=29833|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=June 13, 2015|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref> President Aquino also met with executives of the Aquilini Investment Group who had invested in [[renewable energy]] in the Philippines, particularly [[Cebu]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Business Meeting with Aquilini Investors Group|url=http://rtvm.gov.ph/main/?p=29838|publisher=[http://rtvm.gov.ph/ Presidential Broadcast Staff Radio-Television Malacañang]|accessdate=June 13, 2015|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref> During their meeting, the Aquilini Investment Group also expressed interest in investing in the [[Tourism in the Philippines|tourism]] and the [[Agriculture in the Philippines|agricultural sectors]] of the Philippines.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aquino hails Canada as he expressed optimism over the looming expansion of Philippine-Canada trade|url=http://metrovanindependent.com/2015/05/aquino-hails-canada-as-he-expressed-optimism-over-the-looming-expansion-of-philippine-canada-trade/|accessdate=June 13, 2015|publisher=''[http://metrovanindependent.com/ MetroVan Independent News]''|date=May 11, 2015}}</ref> Finally, the President met with the Filipino community at the [[Vancouver Convention Centre]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Filipino Edition – Philippine President Benigno Aquino III visits Canada|url=http://vancouver.redfm.ca/filipino-edition-philippine-president-benigno-aquino-iii-visits-canada/|accessdate=June 13, 2015|publisher=[[CKYE-FM]]}}</ref> In the evening, President Aquino and his delegation departed Vancouver International Airport for Manila.<ref>{{cite web|title=The President's Day: May 9, 2015|url=http://www.gov.ph/2015/05/09/the-presidents-day-may-9-2015/|publisher=''[[Official Gazette (Philippines)|Official Gazette]]''|accessdate=June 13, 2015|date=May 9, 2015}}</ref>
===Japan (June 2–5)=== [[File:Benigno Aquino III addresses National Diet in Tokyo 6.3.15.jpg|thumb|President Aquino addresses a joint session of the National Diet in Tokyo on June 3, 2015.]] President Aquino traveled to Tokyo for a four-day state visit from June 2 to 5, 2015, aimed at promoting business deals with Japanese investors and seeking support from Japan to resolve the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].<ref name="Japan 2015">{{cite news|last1=Cheng|first1=Willard|title=Aquino embarks on historic Japan state visit|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/06/02/15/aquino-embarks-historic-japan-state-visit|accessdate=June 2, 2015|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|date=June 8, 2015}}</ref>
On Tuesday, June 2, President Aquino arrived at [[Haneda Airport]].
